SENT.plain: Previous reports suggest the probability of stroke after TIA as 20 percent in the first year and 45 percent within five years
Forty-five TIA victims were treated in a stroke prevention program for an average of five years
Efforts were made to correct or control all risk factors
Eight of the 45 experienced further TIA'S, Three had subsequent strokes and two had myocardial infarctions
This stroke prevention program offers an improved prognosis for victims of TIA
